doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/Nomura/Telekom Malaysia T MK Neutral - 2Q25 Subscribers stable as ARPUs took a dent Market competition puts pressure on ARPUs d_2025-08-29

processing_metadata.publication: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/Nomura
processing_metadata.input_relative_path: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/Nomura

passages.text: Market competition puts pressure on ARPUs; downgrade to Neutral, with TP cut to MYR7.85

Telekom Malaysia (TM) posted 1HFY25 EBITDA of MYR2.2bn, accounting for \(44\% /48\%\) of ourBloomberg consensus full- year estimates, which we deem slightly below expectations. 2Q25 revenue at MYR2.77bn was down \(3\% q - q / 5\% y - y\) . 2Q25 EBITDA at MYR1.1bn was up \(4\% q - q\) but down \(1\% y - y\) . TM's core profit of MYR403mn for 2Q was flat q- q and up \(2\% y - y\) . TM declared an interim dividend of MYR0.125 per share.

- Unifi's (unlisted, B2C) 2Q25 revenue at MYR1.38bn was down \(1\% q - q\) and \(y - y\) . Its subscriber base increased marginally (up \(0.1\% q - q\) and up \(1.4\% y - y\) ) to 3.2mn, while ARPU dropped to MYR125 (MYR128 in 2Q24 and MYR127 in 1Q25). According to management, given the intensifying competition in the industry, TM rolled out promotional discounts to retain subscribers and to match the aggressive competition. The current MSAP runs through 2023-2025, and the upcoming revision will apply from 2026-2028. We believe there is a possibility that broadband prices may be lowered further by the government. This, we think, could further add to the pressure on ARPUs amidst the rising competition in the market.- The enterprise business (B2B) segment posted revenue of MYR670.8mn, down \(9.4\% y - y\) and flat q-q. Management reported that TM One's (unlisted) key projects are scheduled for completion in 2H25E, and there were one-offs in 2024. However, it notes positive momentum in connectivity-related offerings, such as cloud services and ICT solutions. Other highlights are mentioned in the next section.

Owing to intensifying market competition, we cut FY25F/FY26F EBITDA estimates by \(7\% /8\%\) . We, however, raise 2025F EPS to reflect the better cost- control as evident in 2Q. We also introduce FY27F forecasts. We roll forward our valuation base to 2026F, and use an unchanged EV/EBITDA multiple of 6.5x (+1.5 SD). We, thus, derive our new, lower TP of MYR7.85. Given the limited upside of \(\sim 12\%\) , we downgrade the stock to Neutral. The stock currently trades at 5.8x 2026F EV/EBITDA. We prefer TIME dotCom (TDC MK, Buy) in the Malaysia fixed telco space.

Malaysia Telecoms Aakash Kedia - NSFSPL
TM started as an state owned telecom company which is currently the biggest fixed line broadband provider in Malaysia. Company has - 3mn customers across two brands - Unifi and Streamyx.
Our TP of MYR7.85 is based on 6.5x 2026F EV/EBITDA multiple 1.55D above five- year average). The benchmark index for this stock is KLCI Malaysia.
Key upside/downside risks come from lower than expected cost savings, volatile macroeconomic and regulatory environment leading to topline uncertainty and higher uptake in premium plans.

Nomura ESG score: 4.3/5.0. We rate TM highly on ESG parameters due to several initiatives on environmental sustainability, human capital development, detailed disclosures and improving shareholder returns. We assign 4.0/4.5/4.5 (out of 5.0) rating to its E/S/G parameters respectively.

- Wholesale business (C2C) revenue at MYR694mn was down \(9\%\) q-q and \(8\%\) y-y. Management indicated that TM Global's (unlisted) outlook looks encouraging, supported by a robust pipeline of cross-border bandwidth projects slated for completion by end-FY25E. On the local front, management confirmed that operations are progressing as planned, with ongoing data centre expansions and the deployment of 5G mobile backhaul infrastructure to support the national 5G network rollout (note).- In terms of revenue by product, the downtrend in voice revenue continued, in line with the global trend. Revenue from voice was down \(6\%\) y-y and flat q-q. Revenue from data was down \(9\%\) y-y and \(6\%\) q-q, while revenue from internet was down \(3\%\) y-y and flat q-q.- The total cost-to-revenue slightly improved, coming in at \(79.4\%\) for the quarter vs \(81.7\%\) in 1Q25 and \(81.1\%\) in 2Q24. This was primarily due to lower manpower and depreciation costs. TM incurred capex of MYR822mn in 1H25 (14.6% of revenue vs \(8\%\) in 1H24), mainly for fibre rollout, 5G mobile back haul project and data centre expansion.- The company currently has a strong cash balance of MYR2.2bn which is down from MYR2.6bn as of June 2024. This is because management is actively repaying debts. The net debt/EBITDA is down to 0.66x vs 0.89x in June 2024.

Risks that may impede the achievement of the target price Downside risks include competition in fixed- line business and lower utilisation of new data centre assets.

A rating of 'Buy', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to outperform the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Neutral', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to perform in line with the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Reduced', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to underperform the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Suspended', indicates that the rating, target price and estimates have been suspended temporarily to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies. A 'Bearish' stance, indicates that the analyst expects the sector to underperform the Benchmark during the next 12 months.
